events.text: It is okay and follows academic integrity standards to omit portions of a quote, as long as you make note of this clearly with ellipses (...).
For example, you might shorten the quote:
“NYU has campuses all over the world, including many in Europe and even one in Shanghai” (Bulletin 10)
“NYU has campuses all over the world...even one in Shanghai” (Bulletin 10).
